intro: [WRONG START] Rubus vulgarus var. rotundatus, commonly known as the blackberry bush, is a species of bramble native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits, known as berries, which are typically dark purple to black when mature. These berries are rich in antioxidants and are often used in culinary applications. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in hedgerows, woodlands, and disturbed soils.
